newsitem.title: USA: MSRB readies dealers for price transparency pilot.
newsitem.headline: MSRB readies dealers for price transparency pilot.

text.p: Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board said Tuesday it requested information from bond dealers in preparation for a Jan 1, 1998, deadline aimed at vastly improving price dissemination in the municipal bond market.
The board said it sent a package of materials, including a 59-part question and answer pamphlet, this week to each broker, dealer and municipal securities dealer listed in board records.
The package asks for contact persons, details on the types of back office systems that firms have, and how they plan to communicated with the board.
MSRB needs the information to launch industrywide testing beginning in July 1997 of price dissemination by dealers to institutional and retail muni investors.
New MSRB rules already require dealers to report dealer-to-dealer trades to the board - a step that has not required few operational changes by dealers.
But beginning next January, all dealer-customer trades, including trades with institutional and retail buyers, must be reported daily to the board.
Information will be collected in a central data base that regulators can use to monitor price reporting in the muni market.

"To report customer transactions, more extensive programming of back-office systems will be necessary," Christopher Taylor, executive director of the MSRB said in a cover letter for this week's mailing.
"In brief, dealers will be responsible to provide to the MSRB each day a computer-readable file of their municipal transactions with customers.
